      • newMultArray

        public void newMultArray()
        Initiates the resultArr for first time users. Each entry tells how many times a number (e.g. 7*6) has to be answered correctly in order to say that it is cleared. Easy numbers like 2*5 must not be answered as many times as harder numbers like 9*8. The indices for each entry in the array corresponds to the number to calculate, e.g. resultArr[7][12] means 7 * 12 and this entry is initiated to 10 since 7*12 is considered "hard".

      • runGame

        public java.lang.String runGame()
        Presents a new number to calculate by fetching two random integers from the result matrix If the number is already cleared, it fetches a new number. This method is only called if player has not yet cleared all numbers so we should be sure that not all entries are zero
        Specified by:
        runGame in interface GameInterface
        Returns:
        String The value to calculate, formatted as e.g. "4 * 11"

      • checkAnswer

        public boolean checkAnswer(int answer)
        Checks if the answer entered by the player is correct or not. If correct answer, the corresponding entry in result matrix is decreased by 1.
        Specified by:
        checkAnswer in interface GameInterface
        Parameters:
        answer - The answer entered by the player
        Returns:
        True if correct answer, otherwise false

      • isCleared

        public boolean isCleared()
        Checks if the current number (e.g. 4*11) has been answered correctly a specified number of times. When a number is cleared it will never show again.
        Specified by:
        isCleared in interface GameInterface
        Returns:
        True if the number is cleared, otherwise false

      • getResultArr

        public int[][] getResultArr()
        Returns resultArr. Used in FileHandler class to save the current results in a file when the user quits the game
        Returns:
        The result matrix
